trans-unit.source: How to: Expose a Metadata Endpoint
trans-unit.target: How to: Expose a Metadata Endpoint

trans-unit.source: A <token>sb2</token> metadata endpoint is a URI that exposes additional information about a service or client application.
trans-unit.target: A <token>sb2</token> metadata endpoint is a URI that exposes additional information about a service or client application.

trans-unit.source: For example, the Svcutil.exe tool uses the exposed metadata from a service to build a contract so that a developer can access that service.
trans-unit.target: For example, the Svcutil.exe tool uses the exposed metadata from a service to build a contract so that a developer can access that service.

trans-unit.source: Without the metadata, the developer would have to gain access to the contract in some other way, such as asking the creator for a copy of it directly via e-mail.
trans-unit.target: Without the metadata, the developer would have to gain access to the contract in some other way, such as asking the creator for a copy of it directly via e-mail.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can still implement an interface without metadata: metadata enables you to easily obtain the contract if you do not already have it.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can still implement an interface without metadata: metadata enables you to easily obtain the contract if you do not already have it.

trans-unit.source: Also note that exposing a metadata endpoint differs from publishing your interface to the ATOM feed: the metadata endpoint contains additional information about the contract, whereas publishing on the ATOM feed just lists the service URI in a publicly-accessed database.
trans-unit.target: Also note that exposing a metadata endpoint differs from publishing your interface to the ATOM feed: the metadata endpoint contains additional information about the contract, whereas publishing on the ATOM feed just lists the service URI in a publicly-accessed database.

trans-unit.source: The following is a simplified procedure for exposing metadata on an application that uses <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following is a simplified procedure for exposing metadata on an application that uses <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: For a complete discussion of metadata, see <link xlink:href="1d37645e-086d-4d68-a358-f3c5b6e8205e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Architecture Overview</link> in the <token>indigo1</token> documentation.
trans-unit.target: For a complete discussion of metadata, see <link xlink:href="1d37645e-086d-4d68-a358-f3c5b6e8205e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Architecture Overview</link> in the <token>indigo1</token> documentation.

trans-unit.source: In the App.config file for the host application, add the metadata endpoint definition to the service configuration information.
trans-unit.target: In the App.config file for the host application, add the metadata endpoint definition to the service configuration information.

trans-unit.source: To add metadata publishing to the service, modify the application configuration information to include an additional <codeInline>behaviors</codeInline> section.
trans-unit.target: To add metadata publishing to the service, modify the application configuration information to include an additional <codeInline>behaviors</codeInline> section.

trans-unit.source: Add the metadata behavior to the service by specifying the <codeInline>behaviorConfiguration</codeInline> property in the service definition.
trans-unit.target: Add the metadata behavior to the service by specifying the <codeInline>behaviorConfiguration</codeInline> property in the service definition.

trans-unit.source: If the metadata endpoint is specified with a different end-to-end security mode than the service endpoint, and uses a relative address while sharing the same base address with the service endpoint, an exception of type <languageKeyword>System.ArgumentException</languageKeyword> is thrown when you open the service host.
trans-unit.target: If the metadata endpoint is specified with a different end-to-end security mode than the service endpoint, and uses a relative address while sharing the same base address with the service endpoint, an exception of type <languageKeyword>System.ArgumentException</languageKeyword> is thrown when you open the service host.

trans-unit.source: The following error message accompanies the exception: <ui>Incompatible channel listener settings</ui>.
trans-unit.target: The following error message accompanies the exception: <ui>Incompatible channel listener settings</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To resolve this issue, perform one of the following workarounds:
trans-unit.target: To resolve this issue, perform one of the following workarounds:

trans-unit.source: Specify the address of the metadata endpoint as a fully-qualified address.
trans-unit.target: Specify the address of the metadata endpoint as a fully-qualified address.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use a relative address for the metadata endpoint that shares a base address with the service endpoint, specify the same end-to-end security mode for both the metadata and service endpoints.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use a relative address for the metadata endpoint that shares a base address with the service endpoint, specify the same end-to-end security mode for both the metadata and service endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Use a relative address for the metadata endpoint with a base address that differs from the base address of the service endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Use a relative address for the metadata endpoint with a base address that differs from the base address of the service endpoint.
